result.execSummary:
The defendant Bill Youa Sue Vang was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct - Loud and Boisterous Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Court Costs are paid in full with application of the cash bond previously posted.  The remaining balance of the cash bond has been refunded to the poster.
Defendant is prohibited from having any contact whatsoever with the victim as named in the Complaint.
Defendant to comply with any other terms or conditions as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.    DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Disorderly Conduct - Loud and Boisterous Conduct
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

defendant.name: Vang, Bill Youa Sue

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 15CM-423 and 16CM-2 - Both Cases Called @ 2:37 PM: Defendant Bill Youa Sue Vang in court with attorney John B. Selsing with Def's Brother Jim Vang to be of assistance with any language barrier.  Stephen Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Interpreter oath administered by the Court.  Global resolution recited by ADA - joint agreement on sentencing.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Victim present and will wish to speak.  Accepting State's motion to allege Loud and Boisterous behavior as to 15CM-423 Plea DC Loud and Boisterous: NC   Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  16CM-2 DRI.  Statement by Victim prior to sentencing.  Statement by Defendant:  None offered.  Court questions Def as to necklace in question - states he does not have it or know its whereabouts.  Off Record for parties to discuss necklace.  Back of Record @ 3:50 PM:  The Court:  60 days WCJ - I/S (GT, Huber No TS credit) - S/W 1 yr probation.  Conditions:  No contact with K. Thao; Any other terms as deemed appropriate; Court Costs - Bond to be Applied - 60 DTP or PP.  DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice.

15CM423 & 16CM2 Cases called @ 3:41 p.m. Defendant Bill Youa Sue Vang in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Anderson - the parties are close to a resolution on both matters. 16CM2 - Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived. NGP entered. ADA Anderson requesting $1000 Sig Bond. No objection by Atty Selsing. Court orders $1000 Sig Bond. Defendant has some limitations in understanding the English languange. DE's brother, Jim Vang, has assisted Atty Selsing with translation. The Court will permit the defendant's brother to assist in translating at the plea/sentencing hearing. P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
from Atty Selsing requesting a plea hearing

Case Called @ 2:08 PM: Defendant Bill Youa Sue Vang in court with attorney John B. Selsing.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms that Defendant does not have a language barrier (Hmong), although brother is present today at counsel's request.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered.  ADA argues as to bond of $650 cash w/conditions.  Argument by Atty Selsing as to bond.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for January 11, 2016 at 03:05 pm.
